DataElement.preferredName: Patient Intermediate CYP3A CYP2C8 Induction Inhibition Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient meets the criteria for enrollment on a clinical trial with regards to administration of intermediate inducers and/or inhibitors of CYP3A or CYP2C8.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Intermediate CYP3A CYP2C8 Induction Inhibition Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol.__Lying between two extremes in time or space or degree._Human CYP3A gene locus is located within 7q21.3-q22.1 and is approximately 218 kb in length. This locus includes four protein-encoding genes, CYP3A4, CYP3A5, CYP3A7 and CYP3A43, and two pseudogenes, CYP3A5P1 and CYP3A5P2. The protein-encoding genes are involved in drug metabolism and the biosynthesis of cholesterol, steroids and other lipids._This gene plays a role in drug metabolism. It is also involved in the oxidation of both endobiotics and xenobiotics._The act of bringing about something._The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Intermediate CYP3A Gene Locus CYP2C8 Gene Induction Inhibition Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Lying between two extremes in time or space or degree.:Human CYP3A gene locus is located within 7q21.3-q22.1 and is approximately 218 kb in length. This locus includes four protein-encoding genes, CYP3A4, CYP3A5, CYP3A7 and CYP3A43, and two pseudogenes, CYP3A5P1 and CYP3A5P2. The protein-encoding genes are involved in drug metabolism and the biosynthesis of cholesterol, steroids and other lipids.:This gene plays a role in drug metabolism. It is also involved in the oxidation of both endobiotics and xenobiotics.:The act of bringing about something.:The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Lying between two extremes in time or space or degree.

Human CYP3A gene locus is located within 7q21.3-q22.1 and is approximately 218 kb in length. This locus includes four protein-encoding genes, CYP3A4, CYP3A5, CYP3A7 and CYP3A43, and two pseudogenes, CYP3A5P1 and CYP3A5P2. The protein-encoding genes are involved in drug metabolism and the biosynthesis of cholesterol, steroids and other lipids.
This gene plays a role in drug metabolism. It is also involved in the oxidation of both endobiotics and xenobiotics.
The act of bringing about something.
The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is on intermediate
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on intermediate inducers or inhibitors of CYP3A or CYP2C8, have attempts been made to switch to an alternative agent or delay enrollment until treatment course with concomitant agent completed?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving any medications that are substrates of CYP3A4 with a narrow therapeutic window, or strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A4, can they be transferred to alternative medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications that are substrates of CYP3A4, with a narrow therapeutic window, or strong inhibitors/inducers of CYP3A4 and cannot be transferred to an alternative medication?
